name: Bishopstrow House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is over fifteen years since our previous stay at Bishopstrow House and nothing much has changed. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Room service tea arrived promptly and was hot. Service at dinner and breakfast was friendly and professional. The food was good as well. Perhaps not quite top notch but never the less, still very good. However, just as the quality of the staff and food had not changed neither had the decor!
reviews.title: In need of refurbushment

likes.disliked: — The shabby decoration and poor maintenance

reviews.text: We stayed in a deluxe room, the Dorchester. On the plus side the room was huge. In most other hotels it would have been classed as a suite. An above average sized bedroom, a separate sitting room, a large bathroom with shower, Jacuzzi bath and twin basins plus a separate toilet. The bed was also very comfortable, not at all like the typical “saggy country house mattress” referred to in a previous review. The room is featured on the hotel website as one of the deluxe rooms and looks great. Unfortunately photographs can tell lies and either the photograph on the website has been heavily retouched or indeed the room has not been decorated for years.
reviews.title: Close to perfect!

likes.disliked: — Lack of signage to restaurant/spa etc.

reviews.text: The Jacuzzi bath was heavily crazed and discoloured. One basin was a patchwork of cracks with a small hole visible. The wallpaper had seen better days and was scratched and torn and in places inexpertly patched. In addition, although the room was well appointed with furniture, much of it had seen better days and was scratched and had large chunks of veneer missing which gave it a very shabby appearance.
reviews.title: A really enjoyable weekend

reviews.text: The maintenance of the room was also poor. At least one door handle was only held on by one screw and where screws had been replaced they were done so inexpertly. In a well maintained hotel I do not expect to see brass door furniture held on by a mixture of steel and black screws. In addition, virtually none of the blinds in any of the rooms worked properly. The cords had obviously broken on many occasions and had either been repaired by knotting the ends together or had just been left broken. It meant that all of the curtains hung at a jaunty angle. I know this is a minor point but all in all it shows a lack of care and attention to detail that you should expect in a top class hotel particularly at their prices.
reviews.title: In desperate need of a refurb!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The stay was saved by the size of the room, the excellent service and food and the house itself which is an architectural delight. However, the owners need to spend some serious money on refurbishing the rooms to make the most of what could be with more care an excellent hotel. I know it can be excellent because it was fifteen years ago when everything was that much newer!
reviews.title: Needs closing down and gutting!

likes.liked: — The open fire in the bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am more than happy to spend money for luxury – being a frequent visitor to the Four Seasons and Aman resorts. However, I hate getting ripped off. And that’s exactly what I think happened at Bishopstrow.
reviews.title: Ripped Off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unbelivably overpriced ! For a bill of about a thousand pounds for 2 nights this should have been much better. Our suite had a carpet that needed a really good clean. No furniture matched.
reviews.title: Disgusting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the hotel is going for shabby chic, the shabby it achieved in spades, the chic utterly eludes it. The setting is lovely as is the surrounding countryside. The public areas are ok the bedrooms unacceptable. A wedge of cardboard to stop the window from rattling at these prices is laughable.
reviews.title: A sad old bin
Okay but some problems
reviews.text: The rooms or certainly the circular suite we stayed in need some serious money spent on them.

reviews.title: A tired hotel
reviews.text: And then, there is the spa! What a poor excuse for a place to recharge. The ceilings had fabric covering the cracks in the plaster. It need and overhall as well. Doesn't compare to a serious spa in Asia. Really disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed in this so called "quintessential English luxury hotel" and if this is the standard of so called luxury hotels I think I will be sticking with the Travelodge.
reviews.title: Well what can I say, four star hotel I think not!

likes.liked: — Fire, The Porter and The Free Tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving into quaint Warminster I thought at last I can relax, get away from it all and enjoy the company of my wife in a hotel where we can be waited on hand and foot (as one would expect at the prices they are charging!), however when we saw the sign for Bishopstrow House our hearts sunk, have we come to the right place I thought?
reviews.title: LOVED IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok so we drove up the doorway and went into the reception (a dark and particularly uninviting dark green room on the right hand side) to be greeted, i use the term loosly, by a very nice young lady and another stood behind the door filling her face with some food..........OK nice start I thought!!!!! So we checked in and the porter helped us with our bags to our room, #21, and also offered to park my car, which I took him up on the offer. Upon arrival to the room we were hit with an awful smell, It smelled as if something had died and was rotting in the room. That was not the only problem with the room, it was very small and to access the wardrobe we had to move the sofa.
reviews.title: Quality in freefall

likes.liked: — it's proximity to my home ensuring that I was home as soon as possible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided that we were not paying the prices they were charging to stay in this hotel room, so when the porter returned with our car keys, fruit and water I promptly told him we would not be staying in this room, to which he said he would see what he could do!
reviews.title: Lovely building, terrible service, and needs updating
Shabby Hotel
reviews.text: He returned to our room within a few minutes with keys to other rooms, all of which were well below standard for the prices and the porter said they were upgrading us on some of the rooms.

description: Welcome to The Bishopstrow Hotel & Spa. Without doubt one of the finest, luxury hotels in Wiltshire.Located within easy reach of Bath and Salisbury (off the A36), only 6 miles from the famed Longleat Safari and Adventure Park.Set in 27 acres of established grounds boasting kitchen gardens, orchard and trout fishing from the banks of the river Wylye running along the hotel, deep in the heart of the beautiful Wiltshire countryside. Ideal for adults and children alike.
